Fields.DialogueText: Everything okay?
*sigh* I wish we could've stayed longer.
In Chinese waters?
Mm-hm.

Fields.MenuText: Me, too.
I'm glad we're gone. It got old fast.
We'll be back before long.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Then maybe we can turn back really quick and just pick up a few souvenirs.
You have to be joking! How can you resist China's charms?
I'll keep my fingers crossed.
You're really not homesick at all?
Not really, I mean... I guess. I just haven't thought about it too much.
Too busy having fun?
That's not what I meant. What we're doing is important.
I agree. But I also think you're having fun.
Okay, maybe I'm having fun too.
*ALARM*
Morganas.
Already?
Maybe they think they can wear us down.
That, or they're gluttons for punishment.
@BATTLE
Hermes.
I know. I wasn't being serious.
Hermes, what are you doing down here?
I'm examining our newly developed fuel.
I told you we're not using it.
I know. That doesn't mean I can't make note of some observations. What's this smell like to you?
*sniff* Uhhhh...

Fields.MenuText: Flowers, maybe?
It smells like some horrible creature hatched from a rotten egg, then took a crap on the street in the middle of summer.
I don't smell anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Flowers? Oh, maybe that's me. Focus on the fuel.
Wow... that's descriptive, but I think you must be smelling yourself or something.
Exactly. Isn't that strange?
A mixture like this should have some kind of smell, good or bad, but I can't smell anything. And don't even get me started on the taste.
You tasted it?
Don't look at me like that. It was for science.
How was it?
*ALARM*
Damn, Morganas. I guess I'll have to finish this later.
Wait, what did it taste like? I'm curious now.
@BATTLE
Oh, Captain, there you are!
In my office? Yeah, strange, isn't it?
I needed to tell someone about Jeffrey and you were the only person I could trust to not spread it around.
Who?
Jeffrey. Officer Reynolds. He works with the engines, sometimes the guns if he's lucky. Anyway, I was talking with Sarah and--
Wait, who's that?
You don't know... *sigh* Officer McDonald. You really should know your crew better, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm just messing with you, Hermes. I know my crew. Y'know, mostly.
I'm sure I know them as well as they know me.
You're more of a people person than I am.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you still know my name.
So not at all?
Well, you're not wrong there. I do love people. They can be so fun and interesting.
Oh, I'm sensing Morganas approaching from the west. I'll sound the alarms.
Wait a minute, what were you going to tell me about?
Oh, they were snogging in the head.
That was information I really didn't need.
@BATTLE
Ouch.
Of course I do, energetic Belle with wings.
Not funny.
Wasn't it, though?
Hermes? Are you out here?
Over here, Captain.
What are you watching?
Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Morganas? Where?
Are we under attack?
Should I sound the alarm?

Fields.DialogueText: They're too far over the horizon for you to see them. But they're there.
No... Not yet, at least.
No, calm down. No need for that yet.
I think... they're following us.
What's that supposed to mean?
It's like they're stalking us.
It's unusual for Morganas to have the kind of patience stalking requires.
Well, I think you're right.
What changed your mind?
Sound the alarm. They're speeding towards us right now.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Yes?
Captain, do you have a moment?

Fields.MenuText: I've got a bad feeling about this.
Sure, what's up?
I'm a little busy, but if you're quick, sure.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't. This is a completely innocent visit. Without any ulterior motives.
Not much. I just want to say hi.
Don't worry, This won't take long at all.
Guys, get in here.
Uhhh, Hermes, what's all this?
Captain, I'd like to introduce you to William, Craig, Elise, John, and Cara.
Yeah, I, uh, I recognize members of my crew. Is there a reason they're here?
They just wanted to say hi.
All right, folks, now go get the next set and bring them in.
Hermes, I see what you're doing. Do we really have time for this?
Sure, it's lunch time.
I know my crew just fine.
You might think that, but can you name one of the five officers that just left?
Slim, Twitch, Newcastle, Mad Dog and Rosey?
That's what I'm talking about. I want you to stop seeing them as just nameless officers. They're people with interests and lives. They matter. Names matter.
*ALARM*
I hear you, okay? But can this wait until after we deal with the incoming Morganas?
Fine... but don't think I'm letting this go!
I know better than to think that.
@BATTLE
Hmmmm... So she tasted this, huh?
Ugh, it looks like chicken noodle motor oil.
I wonder...
Captain, stop! What are you doing?

Fields.MenuText: I was just giving the fuel another smell.
I was curious. You said you tasted it, right?
A little lick never hurt anyone.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank goodness. I thought you'd lost your mind.
I'm a Belle. There are lots of things I can do that you'd die attempting.
It would if you ended up losing your tongue in the process.
Do you think, if I hadn't walked in, that you would have actually tasted that stuff?
I don't know. Curiosity is a strong force, though.
Well, don't be curious. I was just messing with you.
What? You mean you really didn't sample the fuel?
Fuel that looks like that? Never.
*ALARM*
You're not very funny, you know that?
I'm hilarious!
@BATTLE
True enough.
I feel like we've been travelling for years.
Not nearly.
I know you're right, but still. How much longer until we arrive in the UK?
We're not even halfway there yet.
Of course we're not.
Actually, we do need to make a stop soon to pick up some more supplies. We're running low on fuel.
We wouldn't be if you'd just use that new fuel of ours. It might even give us a boost.

Fields.MenuText: It might, but I'm not risking it.
Or it could destroy the ship entirely.
The more you push the point, the more I want to say no.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess it's better safe than sorry, right?
Yes, maybe. But what are the odds of that actually happening?
Now that's just a horrible thing to say, Captain.
Captain, we have Morganas inbound from the south.
Sound the alarm.
Ahem.
Sound the alarm, Twitch.
Um, I'm Craig.
Just sound the alarm!
Smooth.
I'm mostly doing this to irritate you, you know.
It's working.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
More Morganas?
They came at us as soon as we dispatched the other group.

Fields.MenuText: Did they call for help?
How many are there?
Can we take them?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think so. I think these ones just showed up at the same time.
Just a handful. We're not facing an army.
Knowing us? Probably.
Whether it's a coincidence or not, we still have to take care of them.
I very much doubt it's a coincidence, but you're right. There's no running from this battle.
@BATTLE
That's the last of them.
Don't speak too soon.
You think even more are going to come? Don't be crazy.
It was crazy the first time they showed up. We'd be fools not to expect more.
For now... I think we're all right. I'm not sensing any other Morganas.
Good. Then we can be on our way.
For now.
We're safe here, right? No Morganas?
I'm not sensing anything. It should be safe to resupply here.
All right, good. All these Morgana encounters are really draining our supplies.
We are encountering them with greater frequency.

Fields.MenuText: That's war for you.
Something is going on. I just don't know what.
Do you have some idea why?

Fields.DialogueText: That's not just war. Something is different than before.
Me neither, but you're right. It's got to be something.
*sigh* I wish I did, but right now, I've got nothing.
Something has changed. Maybe we need a closer look at the Morganas to figure out what.
No, thank you.
Are you chicken?
Of course not. I'd just really rather the Morganas not feast on this ship.
When you say it like that, it does send a little shiver down my spine.
Captain, there are Morganas approaching the port.
What? I thought you said we were in the clear, Hermes.
We were. This group just came out of nowhere.
Sound the alarm, Slim.
Yes, Captain.
*sigh*
@BATTLE
Uh, Hermes, what are you eating?
Hmmm? Just some soup. What? Were you worried it was the fuel or something?
Maybe a little, but whatever you're eating actually looks pretty good.
This soup is my favorite. I had the ingredients picked up before we left China. Want to try some?
Sure, I'll try a spoonful.
Open up... how do you like it?
It's... interesting. What's in it?
It's shark fin soup.

Fields.MenuText: I knew it tasted familiar. There are a few spices included I'm not used to tasting in my shark fin soup.
Bleh, nope. I'm out of here.
I think I might have just found a new favorite meal.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you think?
Hey, don't spit it out! That's such a waste.
Well, don't get any ideas. I'm not going to share all of mine with you.
*ALARM*
Better finish your shark fast. We've got something more dangerous to defeat.
Hmmm, Morgana fin soup... ick, no, that doesn't sound good at all.
Not everything can turn into soup.
@BATTLE
It's good!
We're nearly halfway there.
It's about time.
We'd be making better time if there weren't so many Morganas hounding us.
Hey, we could've outrun them all if we had used the new fuel.
You don't know that.
I'm extrapolating from what I do know.

Fields.MenuText: Fancy words for guessing.
Extrapo-whatsits?
Well, what I know is that we're moving along at a fine pace without the experimental stuff.

Fields.DialogueText: Scientific words for guessing. Makes them better.
Stop playing dumb, Captain. It's not as cute as you think it is.
Fine, we'll just let the good stuff collect dust in the storage room.
You know, you're hounding me as much as the Morganas at this point.
Speak of the devil.
We have company?
Yeah, we should sound the alarms. I think it's a big one.
@BATTLE
Down here again, huh?
I try to spend as much time here as possible between Morgana attacks. Unfortunately, that time continues to shrink.
If you have a problem with Morgana attacks, then you picked the wrong occupation.
I'm a Belle. There aren't any other choices for me. Besides, the Morganas aren't what I have a problem with.
So you're mad at me?
Yes.

Fields.MenuText: Fine. Then I'm mad at you.
Well, why?
Okay. I'll leave you alone, then.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't be mad at me for being mad at you. That's ridiculous.
You keep ignoring me.
Hey, that's not how this goes.
*sigh* It's just irritating to have a solution to our problems that you refuse to even consider using.
Not every experiment is worth the risk, Hermes. We got lucky with the engine and the bomb, but this could end up blowing up in our faces. Maybe even literally.
Or it could end up saving all our hides.
*ALARM*
I'm done talking about this, Hermes. You can run any tests you want and examine the fuel all day, but we're not putting that in the ship.
Whatever you say.
@BATTLE
How what goes?
I'm supposed to be mad at you and then you're supposed to ask me why and then I get the chance to vent.
Hmm... okay. Why are you mad?
Thomas.
Fine. Officer Levinson.
Good, how about Elise?
Roberts.
Mhmmmm.
Why are you still doing this?
What do you mean? I told you I want you to know your crew as individuals.
I mean, I thought you were mad at me.
I am. What better way to take it out on you?

Fields.MenuText: Heh, good point.
Jokes on you. I'm starting to have fun.
You could punch me. Or kick me.

Fields.DialogueText: This can all stop if you'll just consider using the fuel.
Well, I guess I'll have to crank it up a notch.
I want to punish you, not kill you.
Captain, Morganas are approaching us from our six.
Thank you, Elise. Sound the alarm.
O-okay. You're welcome, Captain.
Very good, Captain.
I still reserve the right to call her Newcastle.
@BATTLE
Hey, Hermes, what's going on?
Hermes?
I'm still mad at you.
I know. I remember. What are you doing here, though, with all that stuff?
I'm trying to strain out the bigger fuel chunks. Once I'm done, I'm hoping to dilute what's left so I can see its effects in a smaller device.
Okay... but why here? You could do that anywhere. Hell, it probably would've been easier to do it in storage.
*shrugs* I don't know. I like the company.

Fields.MenuText: Get out.
Oh... well, carry on, then. I'll be here if you need me.
Do you need help or something?

Fields.DialogueText: Make me.
I probably won't, but I'll keep that in mind.
Nope, it just takes a little time.
*ALARM*
Oh, thank God, that was getting awkward.
What was?
Nothing. Let's just deal with these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Hermes, is this another one of your experiments?
No, I'm dumping some of the fuel out because the ship's trying to lose weight.
What is this even supposed to prove?
I'm curious about its density, how it reacts with seawater, and whether the chunks will float. This is the easiest way to find out.

Fields.MenuText: Just don't get any on the stern, okay?
Don't waste too much.
Couldn't you bring the water up here?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll do my best.
It's not a waste if we learn something.
That would be harder.
Here goes nothing.
Well, that was lackluster.
Now we know it floats.
*ALARM*
Morganas coming in from the north!
They're coming in fast. Everyone get in position!
Wait, Captain, look.
What?
They... I think they stopped.
They're not coming at us anymore. They're just kind of floating there.
Wait a minute.
Hermes, what are you doing? This isn't the time for more tests.
Look.
They're coming at us again!
No, watch. It's going to stop before it gets to us.
How did you know they were going to do that?
They stopped where I spilled it before. I think they might... like it?
Looks like that wasn't enough for them.
They want more, so they're coming straight to the source.
I guess this is why you shouldn't feed the animals.
@BATTLE
So this is why we've been running into so many Morganas.
I think so.
I think they must be attracted to the fuel, or something like that.

Fields.MenuText: Morgana aphrodisiac? Just what this war needed.
Not the best trait for fuel to have.
You sure they weren't just examining the fuel when they came across it?

Fields.DialogueText: That's not quite right, but you're not entirely inaccurate either.
No, not really, unless you want to lure Morganas to you.
That wouldn't explain why they've been hounding us recently.
Are you ready to admit it might've been a good thing we didn't use it?
If we had, we might've been able to outrun all of them.
Maybe. But when we ran out of fuel, we'd still would have had a massive train of Morganas to deal with.
We would've led them all back home. We could've been single-handedly responsible for bringing an armada of Morgana forces to the UK.
All right, now you're taking things a little too far.
*deep breath* You might be right.
What's important now is that we figure out what we should do with this fuel.
*ALARM*
What I meant to say is... what's important now is taking care of these Morganas.
Sure you did.
@BATTLE
Are you sure we have to do this?
You still have a sample of the fuel, right?
Yeah, but this doesn't feel right. Dumping all of it is just a waste.

Fields.MenuText: It's not a waste if we get the Morganas off our backs.
It's waste or be wasted.
Do you have a better idea?

Fields.DialogueText: I guess. I just hope it works.
Catchy phrases will not earn my favor.
No... Wait! No... that wouldn't work.
Let's just get this over with.
That looks hideous.
Not to the Morganas.
And here they come. It looks like they're fighting to get here first.
There's not enough for all of them.
Hmmm, maybe we should thin out the herd...
What are you thinking?
Everyone sound the alarm and get in position.
I hope you know what you're doing.
I know enough. I just wish we had another big bomb to make our job easier.
@BATTLE
Everything okay?
More than.
The seas have been so calm, Captain. I don't know the last time I felt so relaxed.

Fields.MenuText: There's not much better than a Morgana-free voyage.
A little boring for my tastes, actually.
It was a rocky start, but we're nearly in the final stretch.

Fields.DialogueText: More shark fin soup would be nice...
You miss the fighting? Well, we shouldn't have dumped all that fuel, then.
Home, sweet home. I'll admit, I've been feeling just a little homesick.
Captain, we're running low on fuel. It's probably time to make port and restock.
Thank you, John. Tell Cara to change headings.
Yes, Captain.
Good job with the names, Captain.
He was never really much of a "Mad Dog" type anyway.
*ALARM*
Well, I guess it was too much to hope we'd wiped out the Morganas completely.
Did you actually think that?
I can dream, can't I?
@BATTLE
Captain?
What news from the radio room?
Captain, there's a ship in trouble to the north. They're being attacked by Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: How far out of our way are they?
You're sure it's not a trap?
Then I guess we arrived just in time.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, what kind of question is that? We've got to help them. We need to protect them from the Morganas.
It might be. But that shouldn't stop us.
That's my captain!
You're sure they can't handle it themselves?
It doesn't look good.
Then let's hurry. We don't have any time to waste.
@BATTLE
We did a good thing, Captain.
I'm glad you're happy, but that's just one ship. We can't save everyone.
Challenge accepted.
That wasn't a...
I will protect everyone. No one should fear the Morgana threat while I'm around!
She's so sure of herself that even I'm starting to believe her.
Hey, Hermes, you in here?
Hey, Captain. What's going on?
What's with all the paper? Are you writing a book?
No, I'm just writing my report on the engine and the fuel. Oh, and the explosive. I can't forget about that.
A report?

Fields.MenuText: Am I supposed to do one of those too?
It must be a really detailed report.
What's there to write? Bomb went boom, engine went fast, and fuel attracted Morganas. Pretty straight forward.

Fields.DialogueText: No, I'm doing this voluntarily. I mean, you can, but you don't have to.
I try to note all my thoughts along every step of our trip. It helps to write notes.
There's a little more to it than that, but yes, that's kind of the synopsis.
So I take it you're busy with all that?
Did you need something?
Actually, I was hoping you could teach me how to make your variety of shark fin soup.
Really?
I haven't been able to get the taste out of my mind since. I'm kind of craving it.
*ALARM*
I'll make time to teach you as soon as we're done fighting these Morganas.
Sounds perfect.
@BATTLE
Is that what I think it is?
That's home!
We're just a hop, skip, and away now.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you finished that mountain you're calling a report.
I'm looking forward to taking a breather.
Better than China, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, it's completed and collated.
Don't expect too much time to rest. I doubt we'll get more than a good night's sleep before they send us out again.
Close second. Very close second.
Captain, we have Morganas approaching us from the north.
Thank you, Sarah. Sound the alarm.
Yes, Captain.
There aren't many, but they seem to be coming from our destination.
You think they might've just attacked port?
I don't know. I just know they're not getting away easily.
@BATTLE
Welcome back, Captain. Hermes. I trust your travels went well.
Hermes? Care to do the honors?
About as well as could be expected.

Fields.MenuText: Lies.
Do the experiments you take on regularly result in unintended consequences?
Nothing we couldn't handle.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not a lie, it's an opinion.
You should've seen the experimental waterwheels.
But to be fair, we can handle a lot.
I assume you have something for me?
Well, here are the letters from China, and here's my report on the fuel that they transferred to us.
And where is the actual fuel?
Um, we...
We threw it overboard.
What? Why would you do that?
It's all in the report.
It was drawing the Morganas to us like flies on--
Captain, shush!
Really? Interesting...
Sure it is.
Captain, we've spotted Morganas in the area.
Are they approaching?
Not yet.
Okay, then give me a second, Sam.
Yes, Captain.
That sounds like my cue to leave. I'll look over this report and I assume my superiors would like to have a talk with you.
I look forward to hearing from you, then.
@BATTLE
You restock the ammo, William. And you can grab more fuel, Jeffrey, but don't let me catch you slacking off with Sarah - she needs to get more food.
Okay, now you're just showing off.
Maybe a little. But it's a good thing, right?
Yeah, I'm glad you're finally seeing your crew as people.

Fields.MenuText: You know I always did, right? It's always fun to mess with you, but this isn't really going to change how I act as captain.
If I see them all as family, I'll care that much more about all of us coming out of this fight alive.
What are you going to teach me next? How to dance, maybe?

Fields.DialogueText: That's fine. You were already a pretty good captain.
Exactly. I don't want you to die. I don't want anyone to die.
Well, first I'd have to learn how to dance. And trust me, that's a lost cause.
You know, it occurs to me that just because I know the crew better, it doesn't mean they know me better.
Hmmm, you make a decent point. I know you pretty well. Should I start some rumors about you and spread them through the ship?
What? No, that sounds like a horrible plan.
I'd only spread good things. Trust me.
That smile. That one right there is hard to trust.
Fine, I'll prove it. Oh, Elise! Guess what I just heard about the captain!
Where are Morganas when you need them?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, Hermes.
Hey.
What are you, uh, doing here?
I ran out of things to do. I hate just sitting on my hands and waiting, you know?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, I get it. I like to stay active too.
You should enjoy the break while you have it.
It shouldn't last much longer. They'll have our next charge soon.

Fields.DialogueText: Birds of a feather, we are.
I guess... it's just so unproductive. I feel like I should be doing something.
I'm counting the minutes. Literally.
So is there a reason you're in my quarters?
Hmmm? Oh, I just like the company. You don't have to talk to me or anything. Keep doing your work. I'll just sit here.
Hermes, any time you need some company, my door is always open.
Awww. I'm sorry I was mad at you.
I know. Now let me work.
Okay...
*ALARM*
What do you know? There's something for us to do.
Oh, thank goodness, finally!
@BATTLE
According to your report, you kept a small sample of the fuel.
Yes, it's right here. I made sure the vial was sealed in case the Morganas could smell it.
I'll be needing that, thank you.
It's a failure, isn't it?
Maybe as fuel, but it has qualities that could make it an excellent weapon.
By qualities, I assume that means, “Morganas can't get enough of it.”
Precisely.
How is that a useful quality?

Fields.MenuText: He wants to make perfume.
He wants to make a weapon.
He wants to drink it and become the first human Morgana.

Fields.DialogueText: A perfume? Well, I guess if you want to appeal to Morganas, that's the way to go.
What? How would attacking Morganas with something they like be a good weapon?
I... don't think you understand how science works.
I hope we can repurpose this “fuel” and develop it into something we can use against any potential enemies. For all intents and purposes, using the threat of Morganas as a weapon.
That sounds dangerous.
Is now really the best time to worry about fighting amongst ourselves?
I prefer to look at it as a way to bring humanity together by force.
I'm not sure I understand.
The only way we can defeat the Morganas is if humanity fights together. So far we continue to bicker while the Morganas thrive.
So if we must force the world to fight on the same side against the Morganas, using the threat of Morganas, so be it. It's better than the alternative.
You're the scientist. Just don't blow up the world, okay?
No promises.
Are you really okay with all that? It sounded sketchy to me.
Oh, it's definitely sketchy. But at this point, it's also something we have no control over.
Sadly, you're probably right.
Didn't we get our new experiment loaded below deck? Why don't we go check on that?
Fine. They should also have some messages for me to deliver as well.
See, these are things we do have control over.
... True enough.
*ALARM*
Have time for a couple Morganas?
Always.
It's not a weapon to fight Morganas.
You're smarter than you look.
